ch.chnoch.thesis.renderer
Class BoundingBox

java.lang.Object
  ch.chnoch.thesis.renderer.BoundingBox

public class BoundingBox
extends java.lang.Object

A BoundingBox is used for every node that has a shape associated with it. It is defined by its lowest and highest point (in 3D). A bounding box completely surrounds its associated object and can therefore be used for a fast test whether two shapes or a ray and a shape overlap, respectively intersect.

hitPoint

public RayShapeIntersection hitPoint(Ray ray)
Calculates the hit point between this bounding Box and the ray that is passed. The method will return a RayShapeIntersection that contains a boolean whether this box was hit, which node the box belongs to and the closest hit point.

Parameters:
ray - the ray, containing of a point in the 3D space and a direction
Returns:
the ray-shape-intersection, containing of a boolean whether a hit occured, which node got hit and the coordinates of the hitpoint.

update

public BoundingBox update(javax.vecmath.Matrix4f transformation)
Applies the transformations that are stored in the matrix to this bounding box and returns a new instance with the updated lowest and highest point. This updated version can be used for further checking.

Parameters:
transformation - the transformation matrix where all the transformations are stored
Returns:
the transformed bounding box

setUpdated

public void setUpdated()
Sets the updated flag, to know whether this bounding box needs an update or not.
